result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin Michael Link was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
--The Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $100+ costs = $579 plus court appointed attorney fees, to be paid in $30 per month installments to continue as previously ordered with attorney fees payments. Non-payment shall result in a 12 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive.

--The Court determines that Mr. Link already has DNA on file, does not order a sample be taken


****PER 9-22-2016 ORDER - Order for payment of Atty. Teri Strohschein as appointed defense counsel in the amount of $456.90****

records.addlTxt: To Defendant from Bookkeeping - Re: Atty Fees
Order for payment of Atty. Teri Strohschein as appointed defense counsel in the amount of $456.90
with attachments and proposed order for payment of court appointed defense counsel fees from Attorney Strohschein in the amount of $456.90.
cc: Attorney Stohschein, DA  9/6/16  /tn
with Elements Attached
Criminal Case Settlement

Case called at 10:12am [MA]
Defendant Benjamin Michael Link in court with attorney Teri Strohschein.  Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

ADA Beck verifies victim rights compliance.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights given; plea of " NO CONTEST " entered; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

The Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $100+ costs = $579 plus court appointed attorney fees, to be paid in $30 per month installments to continue as previously ordered with attorney fees payments. Non-payment shall result in a 12 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive.

The Court determines that Mr. Link already has DNA on file, does not order a sample be taken
recess: 10:32am
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 29, 2016 at 10:15 am.
FINANCIAL NOTES:  $30.00 AFT payment made at counter via gps.

Defendant Benjamin Michael Link in court with Attorney Teri Strohschein.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Strohschein indicates that she feels that the parties will come to an agreement, but she has some additional information that she first wants to go over with ADA Shock; Attorney Strohschein requests the scheduling of a status conference.
Instead, the Court schedules the case for plea and sentencing hearing.  
recess 9:54am.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 2:38pm [mo]
Defendant Benjamin Michael Link in court.   ADA Theresa Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court reviews the Court Record
The Court reviews Mr. Link's right to counsel.

The Court adds a condition to bond:
Mr. Link is required to go to the Jefferson SPD office TODAY, to schedule an appointment for financial determination, shall Mr. Link be ineligible for SPD representation he is to file with the Clerk of Court's a Petition for County Appointed Attorney.

Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case
Conflict Review Worksheet--No Conflict Found

Case called at 2:41pm [mo]
Defendant Benjamin Michael Link in court.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court discloses, under SCR 60.04 that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, attorneys that DA Wambach supervised did prosecute Mr. Link. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.

Defendant verifies that the date of birth; updates address  
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Mr. Link verifies he was present when the Court gave rights to counsel to another Defedant; indicates he would like counsel

The Court requires $500  signature bond, with conditions: 
--absolute sobriety
--no operation of motor vehicle without a valid drivers license
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department for booking today.
recess: 2:50pm


NEXT: Adjourned Initial Appearance 3/8/2016 at 2:00pm
